959.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: Music, chatter, laughter and gulping of ale can be heard from all
around.  Some people are quietly sitting eating their food, some are
drinking ale or mead, commenting the curves of tavern wenches.  The
tavern is decorated with tapestries and paintings of hunts, battles
and other greater events.  A bright chandelabre sheds light on this
part of the tavern; a small round table with a candle in the midst is
also here, chairs standing around it providing a comfortable position
for both swinging a flagon of ale and viewing the surroundings.  A
quiet dark alcove can be seen to the south and the staircase looms to
the north.

963.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: Music, chatter, laughter and gulping of ale can be heard from all
around.  Some people are quietly sitting eating their food, some are
drinking ale and mead, commenting the curves of tavern wenches.  The
tavern is decorated with tapestries and paintings of hunts, battles
and other greater events.  A bright chandelabre sheds light on this
part of the tavern; a small round table with a candle in the midst is
also here, chairs standing around it providing a comfortable position
for both swinging a flagon of ale and viewing the surroundings.  The
bar is right to the west, scents of good beverages and great food
combine into a tantalizing mix.

966.name: Staircase
description: This staircase leads to the third floor with the private rooms for
rent.  The tavnerkeeper's wife stands here, selling room keys and
occasionally taking fresh towels to the rooms above.  The noise of the
tavern's second floor is still rather loud here.

969.name: Quiet Hallway
description: The hallway is dimly lit with chandelabres.  Not a sound from
downstairs penetrates the silence.  A lush soft rug on the floor
dampens all footsteps making the rest in these rooms a pleasant and
comfortable one.

979.name: Balcony
description: A wonderful view of the Haon'Dor forest opens from here birdsong,
fresh air and a relaxing sight of green is addictive and makes one
want to stay here forever...

964.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: The sound of people having fun is the loudest here.  A resident
bard sits here amusing the patrons and caring for the nice atmosphere
in the inn.  A bright chandelabre sheds light on this part of the
tavern; a small round table with a candle in the midst is also here,
chairs standing around it providing comfortable seating.

955.name: Entrance to the "Prancing Stallion Tavern"
description: {x{x{wStanding at the doors of the tavern, music, voices and singing can
be heard from the inside.  A tantalazing smell of fine beverages
surrounds and envelops, beckoning the thirsty and tired adventurer to
rest inside and have a flagon or two of some fine brew while inside.
A beautiful wall-sized tapestry of a {Wstallion{w hangs here, below,
written in fancy letters are the words "Welcome to the Prancing
Stallion Tavern".  A small credits plaque gleams in the dim light.
Full credits for the building of this area (concept, ideas,
mobprogs, etc etc) go to none other than Pingu!

965.name: Bar
description: A long bar table stretches at the west wall.  A busy tavernkeeper
walks around polishing glasses, mixing drinks and having an occasional
chatter with a customer.  Behind the tavernkeeper stand shelves filled
with miriads of different bottles of drinks made by recipes from all
over Abeir-Toril.  Soothing nice music can be heard from the east
where bards, minstrels and singers gather to entertain the tavernfolk
and themselves with brew and song.  Tantalizing smells of wonderful
food come from the south, where the cook busily prepares meals.  Above
the bar hangs a peculiar {ys{Y{yymbol{x of a rope with four loops.
Upon closer inspections you see the following:
{c({C){c({C){YP{ya{Yx {YF{yae{Yr{yuni{Ys{C({c){C({c)

962.name: Quiet Corner
description: The noise of the tavern left behind, this dimly lit alcove reveals
a comfortable leather sofa sitting near a table.  A single candle in
the middle of the table is all that produces light here.  A
wall-to-wall tapestry of a graceful stallion looks so soothing to the
eye.
A graceful {*black{x stallion standing free of
cares and restraints. Strong and muscular, a true
head of his herd.

970.name: End Of The Hallway
description: The hallway ends here.  Three doors go north, south and west.  The
way back to the lower floors lies east.  Strong {Wdark {go{*a{gk{x doors seem
impassable without the proper keys.  Housing in this quiet and
tranquil place might indeed be a bliss, all one needs to do is buy the
key from downstairs.

975.name: Room 1
description: This room looks cheap for a damn good reason - because it is.
Wandering peasants can easily afford this room to get the comfort
they're used to.  A rough rug covers the floor and a bed stands by the
wall, that's just about all this room has to offer.

961.name: Quiet Corner
description: This quiet corner holds a comfortable cushion, a small table with a
candle dimly lighting the room with a shivering flame and a beautiful
tapestry picturing what seems to be a herd of horses on a wide grassy
plane.
A herd of horses racing around the endless sun-lit
plane, thunderingly galloping to who knows where...

971.name: Room 3
description: This luxurious room has tapestries wall to wall; a huge soft bed
stands on one side of the wall, comfort, high price and luxury.  The
interior promises a good rest for whoever stays here.  To the west a
glass door can be seen leading to the balcony.

981.name: {DBack room of {RThe Floating E{Yy{Re{x
description: This room is what you'd expect from a back room of an inn...
Gambling, smoking, cursing, and occasionally fighting.  A few tables
are scattered around the room, and the whole area is blanketed in a
thin haze of smoke.  The drinks are almost lethally potent, and the
only ones who stand long after consuming them are the duergar.  There
is a surprisingly comfortable looking bed in the corner, apparantly
for those who drink themselves to sleep.

974.name: Room 2
description: A travelling merchant's favorite.  This rooms offers all the
comforts one would need but with no luxury or overwhelming spiffiness
of some more expensive places.  Decorations are scarce, the bed is
comfortable, but a tad hard.

968.name: Quiet Hallway
description: The hallway is dimly lit with chandelabres.  Not a sound from
downstairs penetrates the silence.  A lush soft rug on the floor
dampens all footsteps making the rest in these rooms a pleasant and
comfortable one.

980.name: {yThe {bB{Br{ci{Bn{by {BD{be{ceps{x
description: This bar seems like the model upon which all other "drunken sailor
bars" are based.  The bar and tables are made of unsanded wood, some
of the wood new, some years old.  The walls have more than a few patch
marks and shoddy paintings, mostly used to cover the various scars to
the walls caused by countless armed brawls.  The drinks here are very
potent, both in alcohol content and foul taste.

978.name: Kitchen
description: The roomy kitchen is filled with wonderful aromas of roasts, fries,
stews and whatnot.  A busy cook rambles around the room, running from
stove to stove making sure everything is cooking nicely.

958.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: Music, chatter, laughter and gulping of ale can be heard from all
around.  Some people are quietly sitting eating their food, some are
drinking ale and mead, commenting the curves of tavern wenches.  The
tavern is decorated with tapestries and paintings of hunts, battles
and other greater events.  A bright chandelabre sheds light on this
part of the tavern; a small round table with a candle in the midst is
also here, chairs standing around it providing a comfortable position
for both swinging a flagon of ale and viewing the surroundings.  The
stairs towards the exit from the tavern are to the east, the bar looms
to the far west.

977.name: Tavern Cellar
description: This large cellar is filled wall to wall with supply shelves,
brew tankards, bottle racks, chests and various bags of foodstuff and
alike.  A nimble slender kitty prowls around making sure there's no
rodents plaguing this clean tavern.  A lantern hangs by the door,
lighting all but the darkest corners of the cellar.

967.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: The noise from downstairs has decreased to frail humming, lush
carpeting dampens footsteps.  The hallway to the rooms lies to the
south and one can return downstairs for some fun and brew on the
second floor.

957.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: From the top of the stairs the cozy tavern is in it's magnificent
full view.  Happy tavern patrons can be seen everywhere, gossiping,
playing cards, meeting people and just plain drinking and having a
good time.  The roomy tavern always has a free table and a flagon of
its finest brew available to the weary traveller.  Songs of wandering
minstrels and bards can be heard, pleasantly amusing the visitors.

956.name: Staircase
description: This small room has nothing in but a chandelier hanging on the
ceiling and a firm wooden staircase leading to the second floor, from
where laughter, songs and other noises of people having fun can be
heard.

960.name: Prancing Stallion Tavern
description: Music, chatter, laughter and gulping of ale can be heard from all
around.  Some people are quietly sitting eating their food, some are
drinking ale or mead, commenting the curves of tavern wenches.  The
tavern is decorated with tapestries and paintings of hunts, battles
and other greater events.  A bright chandelabre sheds light on this
part of the tavern; a small round table with a candle in the midst is
also here, chairs standing around it providing a comfortable position
for both swinging a flagon of ale and viewing the surroundings.  A
quiet dark alcove can be seen to the south.

960.name: Tavern Patron~
description:
This mid-wealthy man lounges here, absently sipping ale
and looking around, occasionally poking into a conversation
or just plainly listening around. By his looks one couldn't 
tell much or anything about his profession. Could be a merchant,
a well dressed peasant or just about anyone.
960.room_name: A tavern patron is here, looking around and absently listening to the gossiping

961.name: The Drunkard~
description:
Reaking of alcohol a mile away this chap still looks happy enough. 
Ale and all that goes down his throat and disappears like into a
bottomless pit.
 
*BURP* 
 
No manners as well.
961.room_name: A drunkard sits in the corner, sipping ale, unbothered by the noise

955.name: Vidala~
description:
This middle-aged lady stands by the staircase with a
set of keys in hand, peering at the patrons, waiting
from someone to come up and rent one of the wonderful
rooms this tavern has to offer.
subroutines:
M GRALL 955 100~
M SPEECH 956 boarding~
M BRIBE 957 3000~
M BRIBE 958 6000~
M BRIBE 959 9000~
955.room_name: The innkeeper's wife, Vidala, is standing here giving rooms for rent

956.name: Holdan~
description:
This aged and seasoned man firmly stands by the bar counter pouring
drinks, polishing the bar and making sure everything is in top order
at all times.
956.room_name: Holdan the tavernkeeper stands by the counter waiting for customers

957.name: The Tavern Chef~
description:
This busy overweight man is quite nimble for his size, running
around stoves with frying pans, pots with kitchen utensils in hand he
makes the wonderful foods offered in this fine tavern.
957.room_name: The tavern chef is here, working over a hot sizzling stove

958.name: {*the cat{x~
description:
A cute and furry kitty cat!
 
*purr*
958.room_name: A nimble kitty with sharp claws and {Gg{gr{Geen{x eyes that glow in the dark

959.name: The tavern wench~
description:
This young shaply woman leaves no man cold; curve after curve of
magnificence, long blonde hair, a body to die for.  And wits to spare.
959.room_name: The tavern wench walks around making sure everything is in top order
